critique: The document focuses on national defense and authorizing the Coast Guard to acquire and utilize foreign vessels for training purposes. The primary emotion the President likely wants to elicit is a sense of security and confidence in the government's ability to protect the nation. There might be a secondary emotion of joy that the Coast Guard will be able to train more cadets. There is no information about sadness, anger, fear, or disgust, so those will be scored as 1. Surprise is also not a factor, so it will be scored as 1.
